text:
In light of this approach that weakens Sharia texts and excessively venerates reason, the theologians discussed followers of other religions. Here is Judge Abdul Jabbar saying in the context of his discussion of Christian beliefs: "As for the one among them who relies in this chapter on following predecessors, returning to books, and imitating disciples, his saying is invalid, because speech about the attribute of the Eternal (Al-Qadim) Almighty and what is valid for Him and what is not, it is not permissible to return in it to hearing (texts)..." (1).
Indeed, we find him declaring that his use of texts as evidence, even in issues where he cited texts, was for the sake of support not reliance. The Judge says in the chapter "Proving that he, peace be upon him, is sent to all people" after citing many transmitted texts: "We only mention these wordings for confirmation, and the reliance is what we mentioned of necessary knowledge of his religion and intent..." (2).

Third: Theological Interpretation (Ta'wil):
Proceeding from the obligation of prioritizing reason over transmission, theologians went to the obligation of interpreting texts whose apparent meaning they saw as contradicting reason. Al-Ghazali says: "Every report indicating the affirmation of an attribute for the Creator Almighty whose apparent meaning implies something impossible in reason, is looked into. If it is susceptible to interpretation, it is accepted and interpreted. If no possibility is subsumed under it, the lie of the transmitter becomes definitively clear" (3).
As for Al-Razi, he claimed that resorting to interpretation is inevitable (4) and came with the "Universal Law" which states the obligation of prioritizing reason and interpreting transmission or consigning its meaning (Tafwid).
The groups of innovators used interpretation in their discussions with non-Muslims, whether in their answers to questions directed to them or in the criticism they directed at other religions. Look at the answers of Fakhr al-Din al-Razi in his debate with a Christian when the Christian claimed that there are verses in the Quran suggesting anthropomorphism (Tashbih) and gave as examples His saying, the Most High: {The Most Merciful on the Throne established (5)} [Taha: 5] (5) and His saying: {And your Lord has come and the angels, rank upon rank (22)} [Al-Fajr: 22] (6) and His saying: {And the heavens will be folded in His right hand} [Az-Zumar: 67] (7) and verses from the verses indicating the voluntary attributes of the Lord (8). So Fakhr al-Razi said answering according to the doctrine of the one negating voluntary attributes: "As for the answer to the Hadiths and verses suggesting anthropomorphism, know that if it is established for every rational person, for example, that a wall is inanimate not living, then it is described afterwards with will in His saying, the Most High: {a wall wants to collapse} [Al-Kahf: 77] (9), it is known definitively by the necessity of reason that describing it with will is only by way of metaphor not by way of reality" (10).

He continued answering until he said: "Similarly, if it is known that the Creator Almighty is transcendent above corporeality, accidentality, limit, direction, organs, limbs, movement, and rest, and transcendent above inclination, luck, aversion, and tenderness, then if He is described afterwards with love, pleasure, anger, concern, or with movement and limb, it is known definitively that applying that to Him is metaphor not reality..." (1).
Likewise, we find Judge Abdul Jabbar following the same methodology with Christians, saying in his discussion with them: "Even if what they claimed was established by hearing (text), it would be obligatory to interpret it according to what reason requires" (2).
If we come to Al-Ghazali in his book "Al-Radd Al-Jamil", we find the word "Interpretation" (Ta'wil) repeated in the book. You find it in the preamble of the book as you find it in its conclusion. Indeed, we find Al-Ghazali establishing two principles he mentioned are agreed upon among scholars:
One of them: That texts, if they arrive, if they agree with the rational, they and their apparent meanings are left alone. And if they contradict explicit reason, it is obligatory to interpret them, and believe that their realities are not intended, so they must be returned then to metaphor.
The second: That proofs, if they contradict, and some indicate affirming a ruling and some indicate negating it, we do not leave them contradictory unless we have sensed from ourselves the inability due to the impossibility of combining them, and the prevention of gathering them supporting one meaning (3).
Then he proceeded to critique Christian beliefs in light of these two principles, where he interpreted the texts of the Gospels whose apparent meaning indicates the divinity of Jesus, peace be upon him, inferring with texts indicating his humanity.
The intent here is to clarify that theological interpretation, because of which the general people of desires and theologians specifically suspended Sharia texts, was one of the methodological foundations in studying religions for the theologians.

Fourth: Reliance on Logic and Philosophy:
From the foundations on which the methodology of opponents is based: Reliance on logical rules and philosophical methods and using their terminologies in establishing beliefs. The authors of creeds tried to defend Islam and its truths with logic, and used the philosophical style to confront the philosophical arguments used by followers of religions and atheists.
You may find no difficulty in striking examples indicating the theologians' use of philosophy in studying religions; since all books of the people of desires on creeds - with rare exceptions - were built on this foundation. Words like: substance (Jawhar), accident (Arad), body (Jism), space-occupying (Mutahayyiz), composite (Murakkab), and opposing states are what meet you in the opening of those books at the first principle that must be proven, which is the existence of Allah. Here is Fakhr Al-Razi saying in the beginning of his debate with the Christian: "So I said to him, speech on Prophethood must be preceded by knowledge of the God, and this which you say is false, and faces indicate it: The first face: That the God is an expression of an existence necessarily existing by itself, such that He is not a body, nor space-occupying, nor an accident..." (4).

Criticism of the Methodologies of Ilm al-Kalam (Theology):
It becomes clear to us from the foregoing that the methodologies of the theologians deviated from the correct path due to their pursuing that approach immersed in Aristotelian inferences and rational premises deep in disputation and controversy. Scathing criticism was directed at this methodology by the pillars of Ilm al-Kalam before its opponents, and many of them repented from it, such as Abu Hamid Al-Ghazali, Fakhr Al-Din Al-Razi, and Imam Al-Haramayn Al-Juwayni (1).
So it was known that the theological methodology - even if intended to defend Islam - led to the opposite of the intention, and its errors were exposed to the public. Perhaps the most important of these errors can be summarized as follows:
First: It distanced itself from the methodology of the Quran in calling to establish the creed or defend it, and preferred over it theories and proofs that raise more doubts than persuasion, thus throwing their people into confusion and doubt - let alone others. Sheikh al-Islam said: "You find the people of Kalam the most frequent of people in shifting from one saying to another, and being decisive about a saying in one place, and decisive about its contradictory and declaring its sayer a disbeliever in another subject, and this is proof of lack of certainty" (2). And Al-Shahrastani declared as Ibn Taymiyyah mentioned: "That he found nothing with philosophers and theologians but confusion and regret" (3).
Second: The methodologies of opponents, after the method of Kalam and the method of philosophy mixed in them, became purely theoretical methodologies organizing premises and extracting results, contrary to the Quranic methodology which addresses reason and stirs emotion and thought in its formation of the creed.
Third: The people of desires, by relying on reason alone and judging by it in everything, even in what it is not capable of such as unseen matters, have committed a crime against both reason and Sharia. For they distorted the Sharia due to false interpretation, and divided people completely, and threw them into hatred and animosity, which gave enemies an opportunity to gloat over Islam and its people.
Fourth: The methodologies of the people of desires committed a crime against Islam as they presented it to people in other than its reality due to interpreting or rejecting some texts. They also committed a crime against non-Muslims as they blocked the reality of Islam from them and invited them to innovations and contradictory opinions.

Fifth: The weakness of the methodologies of the people of desires in defending the truth and their inadequacy in refuting falsehood. Sheikh al-Islam said: "And among the greatest causes of the innovations of theologians from Jahmiyyah and others is their inadequacy in debating disbelievers and polytheists. For they debate them and argue with them without truth and justice to support Islam - so they claimed - so those fall upon them due to what is in them of ignorance and injustice, and argue with them with objections and oppositions. So they need then to deny a group of the truth that the Messenger, peace be upon him, came with, and injustice and aggression towards their Muslim brothers due to what those polytheists overcame them with. So their saying became encompassing faith and disbelief, guidance and misguidance, righteousness and error, and combined between contradictories, and they became opposers to disbelievers and believers, like those who fight disbelievers and believers..." (1).
With all this, it is fair and just to mention for the theologians their credit in the field of religious science and sects, for they had a role in refuting falsehood and cutting off the arguments of falsifiers, and this is praiseworthy for them. Sheikh al-Islam said: "And likewise the theologians of the people of affirmation like the Kullabiyyah, Karramiyyah, and Ash'ariyyah, were only accepted and followed and praised by the general Ummah for what they affirmed of the fundamentals of faith from affirming the Maker and His attributes, and affirming Prophethood, and refuting the disbelievers from polytheists and People of the Scripture and clarifying the contradiction of their arguments..." (2). However, this effort does not exempt them from criticism due to their methodological and doctrinal errors which were mentioned previously.
All that preceded confirms to us that the methodology of the Salaf which agrees with the Quranic methodology regulated by Sharia controls is the only methodology in light of which religions and sects should be studied, and it is the appropriate methodology to face contemporary challenges in the field of studying religions and sects (3).

Section Three: Methodologies of Disbelievers in Studying Religious Science
The West did not know the study of religious science and sects in its scientific concept before the modern era. The reason for that is that Christians did not acknowledge the existence of other religions; rather, they considered everything other than Christianity "heresy". Most of the attention of clergymen in that was focused on theological studies, and refuting opinions or religions they saw as posing a danger to Christian beliefs. Add to that, Christianity was protected - according to their claim - by sanctity preventing any criticism directed at it.
But starting from the European Renaissance era - the fifteenth century AD - a major transformation began. Western man began to criticize the Christian religion, just as his interest began in knowing other religions and the beliefs of different nations.
Some scholars determine that the appearance of the term "Comparative Religion" or "Comparative Religion" among Westerners was at the end of the nineteenth century to indicate for them the scientific study of religions to differentiate between this new type of study and the theological studies known to Christianity since its inception.
Then the scope of the science of comparative religion expanded in the twentieth century to include: "History of Religions", "Philosophy of Religions", "Sociology of Religion", "Psychology of Religion", and "Phenomenology of Religion".
The summary is: Religious science in the modern West was born out of the conflict between the Christian religion and the pioneers of the European Renaissance. Those who adopted it were not clergymen, but rather philosophers opposing the Church and its men.

Section Four: Methodologies of Orientalists in Studying Religious Science and Sects and Evaluating them:
Despite the multiplicity of Orientalists' trends, the difference in their orientations, the variance in their fields, and the disparity in their scientific capabilities, they mostly end up in their studies of sects - especially Islam - with one result. That is because they proceed from one set of postulates and issue from methodological foundations planned for specific goals.

Requirement One: The Postulates from which Orientalists Proceeded:
1 - Proceeding from distorted Christianity as a standard for evaluating other religions that are the subject of research and study - especially Islam - such that these religions are not accepted unless they agree with the main propositions of Christianity. And considering everything that deviates from the Christian spiritual model as a deficiency or shortcoming expressing the corruption of this religion, its weakness, and its unreasonableness.
2 - Denying the prophethood of Muhammad, peace be upon him, or considering it specific to Arabs, and considering the Quran as his authorship. Orientalists are either secularists who do not believe in the Unseen, or People of the Scripture who do not believe in the truthfulness of the message that followed Christianity.
3 - Equating the Islamic religion with other pagan religions like the religions of India and China, and distorted heavenly religions. Orientalist Gibb says: "The Islamic religion in itself is one of a group of religions that include alongside Zoroastrianism, Judaism, and Christianity, and it shares with them the same basic principles" (1).
4 - Proceeding from a racist ethnic view that reduces humanity to two races "We" and "They", where the peoples of the earth were divided into superior races and backward ones; the first being Aryan peoples and the second Semitic peoples.
5 - Considering the European experience a normative model for human development. Orientalist studies were dominated by a type of unscientific comparison where Islamic history and its social systems were subjected to Western standards, such that the European experience became the reference that other societies must emulate.
6 - Proceeding from a hostile stance towards Islam, its Prophet peace be upon him, and Muslims. Most Orientalists proceeded from a doctrinal starting point fueled by Crusader hatred for Islam, and fanaticism that blinds eyes from facts.
Proceeding from these starting points and those postulates of theirs led Orientalists to use unscientific methods and methodologies that do not lead to correct results in the field of Islamic studies.

text:
Requirement Two: Methodologies of Orientalists in Studying Religions and Sects:
Orientalists used in studying sects generally and Islamic studies specifically many methodologies, combined or separate. The most important of these methodologies are:

1 - The Historical Critical Method:
Historical criticism of holy books began in the West in the seventeenth century, after publishing holy books in several languages so comparison between different texts became possible... in order to search for the original text. So the texts of the two Testaments were subjected to historical criticism starting from their inception. This criticism included everything related to the two Testaments of translation or explanations. In the nineteenth century, this methodology began to expand and transform into what they called Scientific Criticism based on verifying texts and comparing them, and relying on philology and comparative mythology in this century. The rules of this methodology were laid down and its different schools emerged.
This methodology led Westerners to atheism, when they knew that their religion was incorrect. Whatever the case, the West represented by Orientalist studies applied this methodology to Islamic studies. Paret says: "We in this apply to Islam and its history and to the Arabic works we work on the same critical standard that we apply to the history of thought among us, and to the recorded sources of our own world" (1).
Despite this claim from "Paret", the application of this methodology to Islamic studies was not like its application to Christian or Jewish studies due to what was mentioned previously that the West proceeded in its study from a hostile starting point to Islam, and due to the preconceived judgments Orientalists carried. Therefore, it is said: Most Westerners were not sincere to this methodology in their studies of Islam, and had they been sincere to its rules, it would have been possible for them to reach correct results.

2 - The Analytical Method:
The analytical method is one of the methodologies Orientalists applied to Islamic studies. This methodology means fragmenting the intellectual phenomenon, or the subject required to be studied, into a group of elements that are combined in a heterogeneous bundle of factors or facts that created it. Meaning, this methodology fragments the intellectual phenomenon and returns it to its primary elements like social, political, or religious circumstances. If the Orientalist applies this methodology while influenced by his mood, culture, environment, and religion in which he grew up, he arrives with it in Islamic studies to unsound results. That is because through this methodology they bring every strange interpretation, and return Islamic concepts to non-Islamic origins.

text:
3 - The Projective Method:
I mean projecting the positivist secular vision and contemporary environmental influences onto historical facts. Islam was studied, whether creed or biography and history, with contemporary Western concepts, and compared with Western historical data. Between religious residues, secular tendency, and philosophical opinions, Islam was studied through a positivist vision restricted to the visible, rejecting everything spiritual or unseen, on the basis that it is a fall into the umbrella of imagination, myth, and unscientific. Nothing resulted from applying this methodology to Islamic studies except arbitrary judgments having no connection to sound scientific analysis (1).

4 - Method of Impact and Influence:
Some contemporary researchers see that among the conditions of a researcher in religious science is not to rush when comparing in determining the connection between two phenomena in two religions before the type of relationship between them appears to him, is it similarity, identity, opposition, or contradiction so he does not fall into error (2).
This is what justice and fairness require. But when we come to the methodology of Orientalists in Islamic studies, we find them applying this methodology in a cunning way and without controls. Through this methodology, they conclude that Islam is nothing but a mixture derived from other religions and false sects.
These methodologies used by Orientalists in Islamic studies - from historical criticism, analytical method, impact and influence method, and projective method - contradict those methodologies used by Muslim scholars in the field of studying religions, even if they resemble them outwardly, or agree with them in name. That is because the goal for which Muslim scholars used it differs from the West's goals from it. Their methodologies were built on justice and fairness. No Muslim scholar fabricated lies against people of a religion, nor distorted the history of a nation. Nor did they come with analyses and conclusions that have no basis in truth. How could that be from them when their intention is knowing the reality of religions as they are in reality, so it is possible for them to apply Allah's law on their people.
As for Orientalists, they are either people whose livers Crusader hatred has eaten, or Jews whose hearts hatred filled and arrogance blinded, or secularists and atheists proceeding from a religious background with atheism and disbelief, so they increased in disbelief with their disbelief.

Requirement Three: Orientalists' Methods in Islamic Studies:
What reveals to us the reality of Orientalists' goals through this methodology of theirs, are the methods they used to achieve these methodologies, or features indicating methodological betrayal. The most prominent of these methods:

1 - The Selective Method:
Orientalists do not study Islam as an integrated unit; rather, they study selected topics from it. They focus on topics they see they can employ according to their desires, especially topics representing a negative side in the history of the Islamic nation like innovative sects. "The incoming Western methodology speaks with huge celebration about Mu'tazilism and the Mu'tazila, and sees that their fall was a source of great danger to Islamic thought, and that their methodology is the truest methodology this thought knew..." (1).
From selection also is selecting sources: They select the sources they rely on in Islamic studies, if they don't fabricate them entirely. Their preferred sources are literature books, and books of sects deviating from the correct methodology. From that also is selecting evidences. That is, correct evidences and weak or anomalous evidences might appear in the subject they study, so they choose the anomalous evidences because they agree with their desires, and ignore or pretend blindness to correct evidences, or cast doubt on their authenticity.

2 - Distortion and Inverting Facts:
Orientalists distort texts... intentional distortion, or invert their meanings when they find no room for distortion; by using what is called the reverse method, which is that the Orientalist comes to the most trustworthy news and truest reports and inverts them - intentionally - to their opposite.

3 - Lying and Fabrication:
Among the cunning methods indicating bad intention, and violating methodology for Orientalists: Using methods of deception and camouflage, such as attributing to non-existent sources and references. An example of this is what Dr. Abdul Rahman Badawi mentioned about the Orientalist Lammens where he says: "And the ugliest thing Lammens did, especially in his book Fatima and the Daughters of Muhammad peace be upon him, is that he refers in footnotes to references with their pages. I reviewed most of these references in the books he referred to, and I found that either he refers to places absolutely non-existent in these books, or understands the text in a twisted, malicious way, or extracts implications with extreme arbitrariness, indicating corruption of mind and malice of intention. Therefore, the reader should not rely on his references to sources, for most of them are camouflage, lies, and arbitrariness in understanding texts" (2).

4 - Reliance on Hypotheses and Conjecture:
Reliance on hypotheses and conjectures is a distinctive feature of the Westerners' methodology for studying religions, and it is one of the reasons that threw them into methodological confusion. It is the preferred style for Orientalists in Islamic studies. Orientalist Montgomery Watt says: "Since our knowledge is fragmentary relying on Islamic sources except for inscriptions, there is a large place for assumption and conjecture. We will not treat this subject here, it suffices to mention that it is usually agreed upon that idol worship no longer had influence in the days of Muhammad" (1).

5 - Claiming Objectivity and Detachment:
Among the deceptive methods Orientalists use is claiming objectivity and detachment from desires, but if we come to reality we find no trace of it, rather the opposite is true, which is a matter Orientalists themselves admit. It is strange that you find in most introductions to Orientalists' works the claim of adhering to objectivity in their study of Islam. However, you do not take a single step after the introduction before this same Orientalist surprises you with what contradicts his claim.
Orientalists dealt with religions with these methodologies and used those methods in Islamic studies especially. So their studies regarding Islam came filled with skepticism and defamation, and saying its source is human. Whatever the case, Orientalism has represented in the modern era the spearhead used by enemies against Islam. Its malicious effects on the Islamic nation are not hidden from anyone. It is regrettable to find among Muslims those who glorify the methodologies of Orientalists, and claim that their methodology is the correct scientific methodology. It is regrettable that the production of these fanatics fills the Islamic arena, and that their methodology is a standard for evaluation and criticism in many scientific institutions in the Islamic world, and that "religious science and sects" whose function is confronting the challenge of these people is judged in some houses of knowledge by the methodology of these people.
The intent here from clarifying the methodology of Orientalists is that these Orientalists are more dangerous to Islam than any other force, and that they entered this field while they are not qualified for it, because they are devoid of objectivity and scientific integrity, not to mention what they conceal or declare of hatred and plotting against Islam stemming from an old doctrinal hostility as old as this religion. Despite that - and very regrettably - we will not lack among Muslims those who glorify this methodology, gather for it colors of praise and commendation, and make it a standard and scale for scientific research, even Sharia sciences like the science of religions and sects whose function is defending the religion.
Exiting subordination and imitation of enemies imposes on us to return to our authenticity, by returning to Islam, and liberating ourselves from incoming methodologies. If one of the most dangerous methodologies coming to us is the methodology of studying religions, or history of religions, or comparative religion as they call it in the West because it cares for studying this religion as creed, Sharia, politics and others, then that places the science of sects, and correcting its approach at the beginning of the ladder of our Islamic system. This correction will not be completed except by returning to the Sharia controls established by the people of knowledge, and by liberating from Western methodologies in whole and in detail. Liberation will not be complete unless an alternative comes in this field from scientific encyclopedias and circles of knowledge that dispense researchers from Western sources.

Conclusion
1 - It became clear that the science of religions and sects is among the Sharia sciences whose legitimacy was indicated by the Book, Sunnah, and positions of the Salaf, and that its legitimacy is contingent on its agreement with the Quranic methodology.
2 - Through the methodologies of scholars in the science of religions and sects, it became clear that the scholars of the Salaf adhered to the Sharia methodology.
3 - It was shown through the research that there are methodologies opposing Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah in studying religious science, and they are two methodologies:
First: Methodologies of the theologians and those who agreed with them.
Second: Methodologies of disbelievers and Orientalists.
4 - That some methodologies opposing the methodology of Ahlus-Sunnah have a role in studying religious science like the theologians, which places a large burden on Ahlus-Sunnah to perform this duty; so that no one is deceived by opposing methodologies.
5 - That these methodologies oppose Ahlus-Sunnah in sources and methodologies of inference, in the method of presentation and refutation, and in the method of research.
6 - That research in religious science and studying it has several methodologies including: The descriptive historical method, the analytical critical method, the comparative method, the empirical scientific method, and the comprehensive method.
7 - That Ahlus-Sunnah used from these methodologies what agrees with the truth and leads to it, with its Sharia controls, unlike their opponents who used what agrees with their desires, serves their goals, and achieves their ends.
This, and I ask Allah Almighty to honor His religion and support His word and guide us to what contains good and honor for our nation and support for its religion, for He Almighty is the Grantor of success and the Guide to the straight path. And may Allah send peace and blessings upon our Prophet Muhammad, who clarified for us the path of truth and commanded us to follow it, and clarified for us the path of misguidance and error and forbade us from falling into it, and his family and companions and those who followed them in goodness until the Day of Judgment.
